intro: Psychotria ellipsoidea, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with elliptical, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is adapted to high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its ecological significance and traditional uses, it is also of interest in botanical and ethnobotanical studies.
